channel.title: Asteroid Belt on Notes
channel.description: Recent content in Asteroid Belt on Notes

item.title: Ceres
item.description: Ceres is a dwarf planet in the middle main asteroid belt between the orbits of Mars and Jupiter, the only dwarf planet to be found inside Neptune’s orbit. Ceres is the largest body in the asteroid belt, but is still fairly small. For comparison, even though Ceres comprises 25% of the asteroid belt’s total mass, Pluto is still 14 times more massive. Main resources # Webpages # NASA’s Ceres page: https://science.
